item.title: 2.0-alpha-3 our first open source release
item.author: andy@andywilliams.me (Andrew Williams)
item.description:
HeadsUp Agile's first open source release brings all the tools of Software Engineering and Project Management to all your team members in one easy to use web based application. The HeadsUp Agile system runs on any Unix OS and monitors your source control for code and project metadata. Combining change monitoring, task tracking and progress analytics your development progress will be clearer and faster than ever before

Features include:

  • Source control systems SVN, Git and Mercurial
  • Hierarchical project metadata from Maven, Ant + Ivy, Xcode and Eclipse
  • Continuous Integration for Maven, XCode, Eclipse, Ant and command line
  • Manage Documents, Issues, Milestones and Builds
  • Burndown graphs, project and developer activity charts
  • Browse and download source files and deployed artifacts
  • Project history and cross-summary views
  • Context highlighted search for all stored data

Check out the project page for more information.

item.title: 2.0-alpha-4 brings windows support and preparation for beta-1
item.author: andy@andywilliams.me (Andrew Williams)
item.description:
2.0-alpha-4 introduces full Windows support to HeadsUp Agile.
Released ahead of beta-1 for some serious testing we hope that support for Windows will prove popular

Also in this release are changes that will help the migration to beta-1 using GitHub's infrastructure.

item.title: 2.0-alpha-5 bug fixes and improved stability
item.author: andy@andywilliams.me (Andrew Williams)
item.description:
2.0-alpha-5 is an interim bug fix release as we prepare beta-1.
Improvements include better handling of secure mail servers, strict IRC servers and also improve stability of the overall interface.

We hope to have beta-1 available soon but this should improve your HeadsUp Agile installation in the meantime!

item.title: 2.0-alpha-6 addition of static analysis for XCode projects
item.author: andy@andywilliams.me (Andrew Williams)
item.description:
2.0-alpha-6 adds static code analysis for XCode projects kindly contributed by Adam Boardman

This is the last alpha release and should be considered a beta candidate, we do not expect any major changes between alpha-6 and beta-1.

Apologies for the delay in preparing beta-1 but it will be available very soon!

item.title: 2.0-beta-1 bug fixes to create first beta release
item.author: andy@andywilliams.me (Andrew Williams)
item.description:
2.0-beta-1 adds many bug fixes and small features to create our first beata release

A list of the main changes are as follows:

  • Add footer text for email notifications
  • Update membership and permission screens
  • Better styling to burndown legends and headings
  • Add an hours with fraction string formatter
  • Show accounts their own velocity info
  • Various bug fixes

Please join us in a pint to celebrate the first beta release :)

item.title: 2.0-beta-2 with android lint and milestone grouping
item.author: andy@andywilliams.me (Andrew Williams)
item.description:
2.0-beta-2 adds a couple of often requested features that we hoped to get into the first 2.0 release. Most notable are the inclusion of android lint reports, milestone groups and a quick-search feature for jumping to issue numbers etc.

A list of the other main changes are as follows:

  • Add inline setting of milestone and assignee in issue lists
  • Allow setting debug option at runtime from admin configuration
  • Add button to drop issues currenty assigned to you
  • Correct issues with subscriptions on addigning issues

item.title: 2.0-beta-3 Brings a large list of improvements to the UI and various build agents
item.author: andy@andywilliams.me (Andrew Williams)
item.description:
2.0-beta-3 brings a long list of tweaks to the UI along with great new support for extended build agents and fixes to authentication.
It also deprecated the old XML feed based API and introduced a new JSON based REST API in it's place.

A list of the other main changes are as follows:

  • Support for building Xcode 4 workspaces and for loading CocoaPod dependencies
  • Specifying Ant tasks for build schedules
  • Corrected building of Android apps from Eclipse projects
  • Naming of build schedules and the ability to execute any configuration on demand
  • Group project menu and screens into recent / active / inactive for quicker access to your current projects
  • Improved UI layout on mobile devices
  • New JSON API to replace the deprecated XML feeds
  • Fixes to the authentication handling for artifact downloads and 'remember me' settings
  • Fixed issues with notification handling
  • Fixed issues with Eclipse builds

item.title: 2.0-beta-4 Adds a grouped activity page and new interface filters and fixes a list of reported issues
item.author: andy@andywilliams.me (Andrew Williams)
item.description:
Building on the third beta's interface improvements 2.0-beta-4 completes the interface changes for 2.0 release by adding the requested filters and a new grouped activity page.
Many bugs have also been fixed, including:

  • Hide email and telephone details from anonymous views
  • Improve maven build ordering
  • Add "never" option to build schedules
  • Don't forget the project when displaying an error page
  • Fixed marked up text to render URLs as links
  • Fix some issues with memory constraints when updating
  • Fix possible crashes with the system if setup is not complete
  • Improvements to document edit styling to better match document view styles
  • Fix issue with hour remaining calculations and milestone exports
  • Issue:38 Attach comments to attachments when adding a file
  • Issue:41 Filter milestones in milestone group edit page
  • Fix 'NaN' velocity rendering errors

item.title: First 2.0 release candidate adds Gradle project support and more API endpoints
item.author: andy@andywilliams.me (Andrew Williams)
item.description:
The first release candidate for HeadsUp Agile 2.0 adds Grails project support in addition to adding the following API endpoints:

  • Issues
  • Milestones
  • UserDashboard

In addition the following bugs have been addressed

  • Fix issue where time logged when resolving an issue was not being saved
  • Fix issue where eclipse android projects could not reference local libraries
  • Issue:57 Random ordering of durationworkeds if times match
  • Various DB optimisations
  • Issue:55 Include build config name in artefact upload events and build events
  • Correct encoding of JSON API (to UTF-8)
  • Correct rendering of file sizes to IEC standards
  • Fix an issue with the file "updates" page hanging
  • Fix a problem where projects would simetimes build more than once for a single changeset
  • Issue:60 Upgrade progress bar not updatingi

Please report any issues you have with this release so we can address them before the launch of 2.0

item.title: Second 2.0 release candidate adds many bug fixes and a few new features ready for 2.0 release
item.author: andy@andywilliams.me (Andrew Williams)
item.description:
The second release candidate for HeadsUp Agile 2.0 focuses on bug fixes but also adds the following features in preparation of the 2.0 release:

  • Move the "begin" issue page to a button so it's optional
  • Change ordering of page titles to view real content on browser tabs
  • Add CocoaPods info to XCode projects - fixes issue:44
  • Add a permission denied page rather than always rendering a login screen
  • Hide projects in the menu and project list screen that the user does not have permission to view
  • Add a configuration for the frequency of changeset loading
  • Add support for Xcode 5 test handling

In addition the following bugs have been addressed

  • Fix issue:64 where progressing an issue can appear to alter the time remaining incorrectly
  • Fix issue:62 - don't reset the platform in an xcode project unless the info file is being parsed
  • Fix issue:agile-app-issues:1 autocomplete issue titles when creating relationships
  • Fix some velocity calculations
  • Fix issue where restricted users could not edit their own details
  • Fix issue:65 Build change list showing complete history when revision before is recent
  • Fix an issue that would cause builds started through the interface to delay in starting
  • Fix an issue where searches with a duplicate term could fail to render
  • Fix issue:67 where text markup could link words ending in :

Please report any issues you have with this release so we can address them before the launch of 2.0

item.title: rc3 updates Xcode support in preparation for 2.0 release
item.author: andy@andywilliams.me (Andrew Williams)
item.description:
Our final release candidate focusses on updating tooling for Xcode prior to the big 2.0 launch. The full list of changes is as follows:

  • Add build status endpoint to APIs
  • Use XCPretty to tidy XCode build output, if installed
  • Fix issue where ordering issues by type only ordered by priority
  • Correctly parse Xcode 5 test logs
  • Fix issue where xcode build directories are not correctly cleared if using CocoaPods
  • Fix issue with maven version parsing if a version range was used
  • Fix Issue that Milestone groups do not respect filter when changed (required tracking the completed date of a group)

Please report any last minute problems with this release so we can address them before 2.0 launch.
